column4: how do i re-enable a device that libata has disabled cause of a timeout on hard reset?
option in BIOS?
what?
does it still show up as a device?
yeah
you just can't read from it cause its disabled by libata
enable from grub command line?
you can do that?
libata.atapi_enabled=1
where do you give the device?
this is for a dvd drive: but perhaps similar settings may work for you: http://www.togaware.com/linux/survivor/SATA_CD_DVD.html
how does that have anything to do with this?
it's added to kernel boot parameters: well if it's disabled by libata - then u must enable it
it being what?
the device that you were saying was disabled after a hard reset
well the article you showed me had nothing to do with it
it has to do with enabling libata to run those devices at kernel boot from grub
what type of device are you trying to enable?
libata is enabled obviously
a block device
perhaps: http://www.kernel.org/doc/htmldocs/libata.html ? I'm not sure. I've not run into that problem
good luck & happy new year
